analysis.title: Duplicity
analysis.author: Tony Gilroy
analysis.logline: Two corporate espionage agents with a complicated romantic history attempt to steal a revolutionary hair-growth formula while double-crossing each other and their respective employers.

concept.justification: Unique premise blending corporate espionage with romantic tension, offering fresh take on spy genre

structure.justification: Intricate, non-linear narrative with precise plot mechanics, multiple timelines expertly woven

protagonist.justification: Ray and Claire are complex, morally ambiguous characters with electric chemistry and clear individual motivations

supporting_cast.justification: Rich ensemble of corporate characters like Garsik and Tully with distinct personalities and motivations

dialogue.justification: Razor-sharp, witty exchanges filled with subtext, sexual tension, and professional double-speak

genre_execution.justification: Masterful blend of spy thriller mechanics with romantic comedy timing and corporate satire

originality.justification: Innovative narrative structure, unique corporate espionage context, and meta-commentary on trust

major_weaknesses: Potential complexity might challenge some audiences

target_audience.note: Sophisticated adults interested in smart, sexy thrillers

cast_attachability.note: Leads are compelling roles for A-list actors

marketing_hook.note: Clear trailer potential with sexy espionage angle

budget_return_ratio.note: Moderate budget with high commercial potential

comparable_success.note: Similar to Ocean's Eleven and Mr. & Mrs. Smith

structure_analysis.act_breaks: First act: Meet protagonists, Second act: Corporate infiltration, Third act: Final con
structure_analysis.pacing: fast with deliberate moments of complexity

characters.protagonist: Ray Koval - Charming MI6 operative turned corporate spy, goal of pulling off ultimate corporate heist
characters.antagonist: Corporate leaders Howard Tully and Dick Garsik, competing for revolutionary product
supporting: Claire Stenwick - Ray's romantic and professional counterpart

standout_scenes.why: Establishes complex relationship with electric chemistry
Demonstrates intricate plot mechanics and character dynamics

budget_tier.justification: Requires quality production design, multiple locations, A-list talent

assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptional screenplay demonstrating mastery of genre with compelling characters, innovative structure, and commercial potential. Weighted score of 8.90 with zero critical failures and perfect commercial viability score.

film_now_assessment.lightning_test: Opening corporate jet confrontation establishes high-stakes, comedic tone immediately
goosebumps_moments: Page 38: Romantic tension in Rome hotel
film_now_assessment.career_risk_test: Absolutely. This screenplay represents a generational blend of genres with commercial and artistic merit.
film_now_assessment.legacy_potential: High - unique take on spy genre that deconstructs corporate and romantic narratives

analysis.verdict_statement: FILM NOW: DUPLICITY represents exceptional material that demands immediate greenlight consideration. The Lightning: A corporate espionage romance that redefines genre expectations. The Craft: Weighted score of 8.90 with no dimension below 8. The Commercial Case: CVS of 18/18. Clive Owen/Julia Roberts level star potential. Urgency: This screenplay will not remain available.
